ticket.title: Using Rails-2.3.5 with ruby 1.9.2dev (2009-07-18 trunk 24186) [x86_64-linux]
ticket.original-body:
I cannot seem to get Rails to work with this version of Ruby. I am not sure whether I should report this here or on the Ruby project. If it belongs there just let me know and I will move it along.
$ rails --help /home/byrnejb/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.2-preview1/gems/activesupport-2.3.5/lib/active_support/core_ext/try.rb:29: [BUG] rb_add_method: unsupported method type (8)
The full back trace is attached.

version.title: Using Rails-2.3.5 with ruby 1.9.2dev (2009-07-18 trunk 24186) [x86_64-linux]

version.body: Ruby 1.9.2 preview 1, and older builds from last year do have a number of bugs, for a start you'll find it will leak large amounts of RAM under x64. If you are using Ruby 1.9.2, a very recent revision from trunk.
version.body-html: Ruby 1.9.2 preview 1, and older builds from last year do have a number of bugs, for a start you'll find it will leak large amounts of RAM under x64. If you are using Ruby 1.9.2, a very recent revision from trunk.
version.title: Using Rails-2.3.5 with ruby 1.9.2dev (2009-07-18 trunk 24186) [x86_64-linux]

version.body: There are many Ruby 1.9 bugs, please report on http://redmine.ruby-lang.org/
version.body-html: There are many Ruby 1.9 bugs, please report on http://redmine.ruby-lang.org/
